alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Groveport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Reynoldsburg, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Millersport, Fairfield Beach, Harbor Hills, Etna, Obetz, Lithopolis, Thurston, Kirkersville, Brice, Blacklick Estates, State Route 158 at State Route 204 and Interstate 70 at State Route 37. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 110 and 113, and between mile markers 117 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
